title: How to get the dob changed on 10th certificate - Quora

response.answer_text: (i) As per Rule of the C.B.S.E Board, no change in the date of birth once recorded in the Board’s records shall be made. corrections regarding errors and correct typing to make the certificate more consistent with the school records is made provided that corrections in the school records should not have been considered after the submission of application form for admission to examination related issues. (ii) Such correction in the dob of a candidate in case of genuine errors is made after establishing that the wrong entry was made in the list of candidates/application form of the candidate for the examination. (iii) Request for correction in dob has to be forwarded by the principal of school along with attested photostat copies of : (a) application of the candidate at the time of admission to the school; (b) a portion of the page of admission and withdrawal register where the entry in the dob has been made. (c) The School Leaving Certificate of the previous school . (iv) The application for correction in the dob, forwarded by the principal of school along with documents mentioned above will be considered by the Board only within five years of the date of announcement of result. No correction whatsoever shall be made on the application submitted after a period of five years

Question: Whether you can change the Date of Birth in your Tenth Certificate? Answer : It depends what evidence you have to substantiate and corroborate your claim that the date of birth mentioned in your tenth certificate is incorrect and the one you're looking to amend is indeed the correct one. Once you have accumulated the requisite documents to prove your case, send a legal notice to your school as well as the concerned board of education of that particular state or whichever board was applicable. The notice should contain the averments of your claim, photocopy of supporting documents and a time frame within which they must reply or make amendments asked for. If within the specified time frame you don't receive a reply, you can approach the Hon'ble High Court having territorial jurisdiction over the school / relevant board by way of Civil Writ Petition under Article 226 and 227 of Constitution of India or Hon'ble Supreme Court under Article 32 of Constitution of India, to direct the concerned school / board to make amendments to your certificate. Prove your case on merits before the Hon'ble High Court or Supreme Court, as the case may be, and the Court will direct them to make amends.
